_header: Now great glorious God through grace of himselven

Lincoln91.First Lines:
Now grett glorious godd thurgh grace of hym seluenAnd the precyous
                    prayere of hys prys modyr…
Lincoln91.Last Lines:
…ffro theythenne broghte the bretons all his bolde EldyrsIn to
                    bretayne the brode as þe bruytte tellys
Lincoln91.Note:
Followed by Latin, ‘Hic Iacet Arthurus rex quondam rexque
                        futurus’ before explicit.
Lincoln91.Attributed Title:
He[re] begynnes Morte Arthure (f. 53); Here endes Morte Arthure writen by
                    Robert of Thornton (f. 98v)
